gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc
Class SatelliteSituationCenter

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc.SatelliteSituationCenter

public class SatelliteSituationCenter
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the XML Web Service interface to NASA's Satellite Situation Center.

Notes:

  • These Web Services adhere to the NASA Web Privacy Policy and Important Notices. A link to these notices are also programatically available through the getPrivacyAndImportantNotices() method.
  • When refering to this javadoc documentation of this Web Service interface, be aware that the code-level details seen by a client developer may contain differences. For example, where this javadoc documentation may describe a parameter as being of type java.util.Calendar, a client developer may be required to use a different type such as javax.xml.datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar. These types of differences are determined by the language (Java, Perl, etc.) and the tools and libararies (for example JAX-WS) the client is using. The WSDL is the offical description of this Web Service. None the less, this javadoc documentation contains important semantic information about about this Web Service that is valuable to a client developer regardless of the language or tools they may be using.
  • You are strongly encouraged to have your client set the HTTP User-Agent header (RFC 2068) to a value that identifies your client application in each SSC Web Service request that it makes. This will allow us to measure the usefulness of these services and justify their continued support. It isn't too important what value you use but it is best if it uniquely identifies your application. The specifics of how to do this in the client varies depending upon the programming language and support libraries used for the client.
  • There are server computer resource limits imposed on the methods of this interface. While these limits are not expected to be limiting for legitimate requests, making requests for a long period of time or for a large number of spacecraft can exceed these limits and result in a "request exceeded computer resource limits" exception. A client may want to be prepared to deal with such occasions.

Version:
$Revision: 1.13.4.14.2.6 $
Author:
B. Harris

getAllSatellites

public java.util.List<SatelliteDescription> getAllSatellites()
                                                      throws SSCExternalException
Provides the names of all the Satellites available through this Web Service. The names are returned in ascending alphabetical order.

Returns:
list containing the names of all the available satellites
Throws:
SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request

getSatelliteTime

@Deprecated
public TimeInterval getSatelliteTime(java.lang.String satellite)
                              throws SSCExternalException
Deprecated. As of 2.0, this same information is available in the SatelliteDescription returned by getAllSatellites()

Requests the time range of available location information for the specified satellite.

Parameters:
satellite - the identifier of the satellite whose location information time range is being requested
Returns:
TimeInterval containing the starting and ending date for which location information is available
Throws:
SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request

getSatelliteResolution

@Deprecated
public int getSatelliteResolution(java.lang.String satellite)
                           throws SSCExternalException
Deprecated. As of 2.0, this same information is available in the SatelliteDescription returned by getAllSatellites()

Requests the maximum location information resolution (in seconds) available for the specified satellite. For example, a value of 60 indicates that location information is available down to a 60 second interval between points.

Parameters:
satellite - the identifier of the satellite whose resolution value is being requested
Returns:
the maximum location information resolution available (seconds)
Throws:
SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request
